message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The study uses the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) indicators dataset and the World Bank's Global Consumption Database to examine poverty trends in low-income countries over the period 2000-2015.", "dataset": ["Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) indicators dataset", "World Bank's Global Consumption Database"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This research work employed a mixed-method approach, combining data from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to explore the correlates of child malnutrition among under-five children in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS) data linked with regional weather indicators dataset, we estimate the effect of climate change variability on crop productivity and farm incomes in Uganda.", "dataset": ["Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS)", "regional weather indicators dataset"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we explore the relationship between social protection interventions and their impacts on school enrollment rates in developing countries using data from the Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) and the World Bank's Social Protection and Labor Global Practice database.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)", "World Bank's Social Protection and Labor Global Practice database"], "topic": ["Education", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes two datasets: the Universal Health Coverage (UHC) service coverage index dataset and the World Health Organization's Global Health Observatory (GHO) dataset, to evaluate the progress towards achieving equitable access to quality healthcare services in low-and-middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Universal Health Coverage (UHC) service coverage index dataset", "World Health Organization's Global Health Observatory (GHO) dataset"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze firm-level bank lending data linked to a unique dataset on the mobile money market in Uganda, using a difference-in-differences regression design to assess the effect of mobile money on access to credit for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).", "dataset": ["firm-level bank lending data", "unique dataset on the mobile money market in Uganda"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey datasets from Nigeria and South Africa, we find that innovations in digital banking services have increased the number of households adopting formal financial products and services.", "dataset": ["household survey datasets from Nigeria", "South Africa"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a cross-country panel dataset approach, using data from the Bankscope and World Bank Enterprise Survey (WBES) datasets, to investigate the impact of financial sector development on economic growth in the Eurozone region over the period 2000-2018.", "dataset": ["Bankscope", "World Bank Enterprise Survey (WBES) datasets"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the International Trade Centre (ITC) and the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)'s Time Use Database, to compare changes in men and women's employment patterns across different sectors in several low-and-middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["International Trade Centre (ITC)", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)'s Time Use Database"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the effect of oil production on forest conservation efforts using data from the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) Forest Resource Assessment (FRA) dataset combined with petroleum production data from the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI) in several South American countries.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) Forest Resource Assessment (FRA) dataset", "Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI)"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}]
